lexUnit.name: belated.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: coming late or too late.

sentence.text: I edged around the puddles in the garden , where belated rain fell from the yew trees , and returned to my Bed and Breakfast house for a soothing sleep .
Since employees often complain about receiving belated information particular management attention should be given to correct timing .
After my belated conversion from the outworn pieties of my youth what I wanted from Karen was a crash course in greed , voracity , cheap thrills and superficial emotion .
However , on his belated homecomings , he indirectly reassured her that the needed person did return m- the end .
That belated discovery caused Sun to cancel the intended roll-out of the expected 514 ( UX No 432 ) .
The reduction in the ARC 's subsidy is a belated acknowledgement that agricultural research is overfunded ( see Nature 362 , 386 ; 1993 ) .
The marquis made one belated attempt to warn her .
` Hence the ` belated honeymoon " he talked about , " said Julia .
The Revolution certainly marked a belated victory for the policy of Exclusion , and finally established the legislative sovereignty of Parliament .
The couple have spent the past six months buying furniture for their rooms within the Godfrey Ermen Home and are considering a belated honeymoon .
Etosha has long been well regarded by her trainer and her belated debut in the John Holdrish Maiden Fillies Stakes was explained by a long-held aversion to starting stalls .
The breakthrough was inspired by belated realisation on the part of Pretoria and the ANC that unless they made rapid progress what is left of the South African economy would be wrecked .
Dates and September and October had proved to be difficult and beyond that , it would be a very belated welcome .
Although belated , the gesture will win Mr Kaifu kudos in Washington , and guarantee a warm welcome for him at the London summit of rich countries ' leaders in July .
After such stumbles , Grumman is understandably thrilled by a belated and unambiguous triumph : the success of JSTARS .
Perhaps , in retrospect , I was over-kind in interpreting the offensive ` Bengali In Platforms " as a belated working through of petty teenage bigotry .
A letter to the Japanese ambassador in Washington , signed by all 100 members of the US Senate , had preceded what the US saw as Japan 's belated Aug. 5 commitment on sanctions .
